page.title: 03KEMP TOWN HOUSING
page.content: The Kemp Town area mainly consists of high density terraced housing. Although the area contains many of the commonly found C20th buildings, its main character & identity lies in its{C19th}houses. Many are built in the classical mode of brick with stone dressings & iron railings. Some houses are however faced with Mathematical tiles, a characteristic of the county. Many of the streets are quite narrow & few of the houses have gardens, though some have roof gardens. Many of the older houses have mews behind them which have often been converted to holiday homes. The Edwardian houses however don't have mews. Some have garages, particularly the houses surrounding Queens Park. Most of the seafront consists just of listed buildings.
